column4: My desktop just recently started logging the session out for no apparent reason while I'm working. The screen goes black, I see some text like you won't on a re-boot and then I'm back at the GUI login. Once I login again, my session was closed and appears as the user (me) was logged out. I'm using Ubuntu 8.04 default Gnome desktop, any idea why is is happening?
I'm guessing video driver issues. what is your video?
when the X server unexpectedly dies, it will throw you back out at the gdm login screen
gdm being the graphic login you'd on any install even if the video driver were incorrect or not functioning correctly?   I have an Nvida card, think I'm using the "restricted" drivers too.
Any suggestions?
can you tail /var/log/Xorg.0.log when this happens?
Not really... as it closes my session and I am forced to login again.  I can view the log after the "crash" though.
that's fine.. just something to help diagnose why it's crashing
also perhaps try updating your video drivers
does your crash happen after any certain amount of time? on any certain operation?
Not quite sure yet. Has only happened once a day for the last 4 days. Not in a specific application, but perhaps when I'm minimizing a window (MAYBE).
sudo apt-get install envyng-gtk to get some new nvidia drivers
(and then run apps -> system tools -> envyng)
ok
brb reboot
EnvyNG installed.  Guess we'll see how it goes.
have you actually run EnvyNG yet? it grabs the drivers for you when you run it. if you haven't run it yet you don't have new drivers.
applications -> system tools -> envyng .. run it.
yes...  Apps > system > EnvyNG
so it installed the drivers and rebooted you?
yes
So that's it..... sit and wait for it to happen again?
